intro: Gnaphalium hololeucum, commonly known as the white cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, often covered in fine white hairs, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Gnaphalium hololeucum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
